bill.title: Kansas itemized deductions, election; providing for deferred foreign income, global intangible low-taxed income, capital contributions and FDIC premiums income tax modifications; expanding the expense deduction for all taxpayers; extending the net operating loss carryforward period; sales and compensating use tax, imposition of tax, nexus, remote sellers, marketplace facilitators, rate of tax on food and food ingredients; countywide retailers’ sales tax authority for Finney County and requirements for director of taxation for collection.
bill.description: Kansas itemized deductions, election; providing for deferred foreign income, global intangible low-taxed income, capital contributions and FDIC premiums income tax modifications; expanding the expense deduction for all taxpayers; extending the net operating loss carryforward period; sales and compensating use tax, imposition of tax, nexus, remote sellers, marketplace facilitators, rate of tax on food and food ingredients; countywide retailers’ sales tax authority for Finney County and requirements for director of taxation for collection.

history.action: House Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Taxation
House Hearing: Wednesday, January 23, 2019, 3:30 PM Room 112-N
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Taxation
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Smith, A.
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Smith, A. was adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Hodge
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Hodge was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 79 Nay: 36
House Engrossed on Thursday, February 7, 2019
Senate Received and Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Assessment and Taxation
Senate Hearing: Wednesday, February 20, 2019, 9:30 AM Room 548-S
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Assessment and Taxation
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 39 Nay: 0
House Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Representative Johnson , Representative Mason and Representative Gartner as conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator Tyson,  Senator Kerschen and  Senator Holland appointed as conferees
Senate  Senator Wagle is appointed to replace  Senator Tyson on the Conference Committee
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator Wagle,  Senator Kerschen and  Senator Holland appointed as conferees
House Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Representative Johnson,  Representative Mason and  Representative Gartner appointed as second conferees
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 27 Nay: 13
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 83 Nay: 41
House Reengrossed on Monday, May 6, 2019
House Enrolled and presented to Governor on Friday, May 10, 2019
House Vetoed by Governor; Returned to House on Friday, May 17, 2019
House Motion to override veto failed; Veto sustained;  Yea: 78 Nay: 39

votes.desc: House Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 79 Nay: 36
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 39 Nay: 0
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 27 Nay: 13
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 83 Nay: 41
House Motion to override veto failed; Veto sustained - Yea: 78 Nay: 39
